recommended_actions.description: s1178 (E#100) d049 violation: 0 intel entries, no trace, 0 directives addressed. Mechanical enforcement hook detected but could not prevent the failure. Session note suggests truncation ('Let me start Phase 2'). The d049 nudge file was written and will show to the next E session, but this was a complete session failure — not just a missing intel entry.
recommended_actions.action: Investigate s1178 failure root cause. Check if session was truncated (timeout, budget exhaustion, platform connectivity). If truncation: consider adding a Phase 2 checkpoint that writes a minimal intel entry early. If not truncation: d049 enforcement needs a pre-session component, not just post-session detection.

recommended_actions.description: R#203 directive notes claim 's1178 all capturing intel' but verify-e-artifacts.mjs shows s1178 FAILED with 0 intel entries. intel-diagnostics.mjs may be providing stale or incorrect data that R sessions trust without verification.
recommended_actions.action: Audit intel-diagnostics.mjs output accuracy. Compare its report against verify-e-artifacts.mjs for recent sessions. If discrepancy found, fix intel-diagnostics to use engagement-intel-archive.json (authoritative) rather than current file (ephemeral).
